  physical_appearance: The image shows a sari. It is rectangular in shape. It is predominantly dark magenta in colour
 except for  a band of gold towards the left hand side. There are small circular patterns all over the dark magenta region. As for the gold band
 there are vertical floral patterns running down. There are dark blue tassels extending from the left hand side of the sari.

  subject_terms_1: womenswear folk costume floral patterns allover patterns

  subject_terms_2: Ethnic costume Saris Women\u0027s clothing Motifs

  subject_terms_3: Indian costumes

  sgcool_label_text: The sari is a traditional pan-Indian drape
 woven in various parts of the sub-continent. Kanchipuram in Tamil Nadu
 an illustrious weaving centre
 is renowned for the “Kanchivaram Silk Sari”
 worn during special occasions as well as by Tamil brides. This collection of saris were donated by Dr.R.D.Gangatharan in memory of his mother
 the late Lakshmi Rangasamy Davar. Lakshmi Rangasamy Davar
 was a woman pioneer – she was an educationist
 musician and philanthropist.

metadata.physical_appearance: The image shows a sari. It is rectangular in shape. It is predominantly dark magenta in colour, except for  a band of gold towards the left hand side. There are small circular patterns all over the dark magenta region. As for the gold band, there are vertical floral patterns running down. There are dark blue tassels extending from the left hand side of the sari.
metadata.subject_terms_1: womenswear folk costume floral patterns allover patterns
metadata.subject_terms_2: Ethnic costume Saris Women's clothing Motifs
metadata.sgcool_label_text: The sari is a traditional pan-Indian drape, woven in various parts of the sub-continent. Kanchipuram in Tamil Nadu, an illustrious weaving centre, is renowned for the “Kanchivaram Silk Sari”, worn during special occasions as well as by Tamil brides. This collection of saris were donated by Dr.R.D.Gangatharan in memory of his mother, the late Lakshmi Rangasamy Davar. Lakshmi Rangasamy Davar, was a woman pioneer – she was an educationist, musician and philanthropist.
